results.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Alan Feuer
results.title: Classified Documents Found in Trump Search of Storage Site
results.abstract: The discovery came as series of searches were conducted by a team hired by the former president, after a federal judge directed his lawyers to look for any materials still in his possession.

media.caption: The F.B.I. searched Mar-a-Lago, former President Donald J. Trump’s private club and residence in Palm Beach, Fla., in August for classified documents and presidential records.

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Eyes and Eyesight;LASIK (Eye Surgery);Surgery and Surgeons;Medical Devices;Corneas;Food and Drug Administration;United States
results.title: Lasik Patients Should Be Warned of Complications, F.D.A. Draft Says
results.abstract: Draft recommendations by the agency describe dry eyes, visual disturbances and other side effects of the procedure. Surgeons say the benefits are being ignored.

media.caption: More than half a million Americans undergo Lasik surgery each year, hoping to remedy poor eyesight.
media.copyright: Uli Seit for The New York Times

results.title: After Herschel Walker’s Defeat, His Son Piles On With Twitter Tirade
results.abstract: Christian Walker, the estranged son of Herschel Walker, had harsh words for his father and the Republican Party as Georgia’s Senate race was called.

media.caption: Christian Walker, center, in 2020. He lashed out on Tuesday against his father, Herschel Walker, who lost Georgia’s Senate race after a series of scandals.

results.title: Trump Bedeviled by Company’s Conviction and Senate Candidate’s Defeat
results.abstract: The Trump Organization was branded a felon. Herschel Walker was defeated in Georgia. Donald J. Trump has had better Tuesdays.

results.title: What Do We Know About Prince Heinrich XIII of Reuss?
results.abstract: Descended from an ancient aristocratic family, Heinrich now stands accused of being a leader of a far-right plot to overthrow the German government.

media.caption: Prince Heinrich XIII of Reuss, center, being detained in Frankfurt, Germany, on Wednesday in a raid against a far-right group accused of plotting to overthrow the government.

results.title: Democrats Didn’t Just Win Georgia. They Secured a Firmer Grip on the Senate.
results.abstract: Senator Raphael Warnock’s victory provides a real working majority for Democrats after two years of a tenuous 50-50 split.

results.title: Judge in Trump Company Trial Knew How to Read the Numbers

results.title: Congress Poised to Repeal Covid Vaccine Mandate for Troops in Military Bill
results.abstract: Republicans and Democrats agreed to roll back the requirement as part of an $858 billion military policy measure, acting over the Biden administration’s objections.

results.title: Why the Defeat of Herschel Walker, Trump’s Celebrity Pick, Matters
results.abstract: Walker was a horrific candidate, but the Trump brand has also begun to sour in Georgia.

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Senate;Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Voting Rights, Registration and Requirements;Presidential Election of 2024;Warnock, Raphael G;Walker, Herschel;Trump, Donald J;Democratic Party;Republican Party;Georgia
results.title: 5 Georgia Takeaways: Scandals Still Matter, and Trump Faces Blowback
results.abstract: Herschel Walker’s loss to Senator Raphael Warnock showed that flawed candidates cannot always rely on partisan loyalties to lift them. And it is likely to deepen Republican infighting over Donald Trump’s drag on the party.

media.caption: Herschel Walker, left, came up short in his challenge to Senator Raphael Warnock, whose victory for Democrats signaled that Georgia will remain a crucial battleground state in 2024 and beyond.

results.title: Mayor Eric Adams, Fined For Rats on His Property, Takes on City Hall
results.abstract: Mr. Adams, a noted rat antagonist who once endorsed a special rat-drowning device, on Tuesday contested a summons and fine over an infestation at a rental property he owns.

results.byline: By Keith Bradsher, Chang Che and Amy Chang Chien
results.title: China Eases ‘Zero Covid’ Restrictions in Victory for Protesters
results.abstract: Beijing’s costly policy of lockdowns has pummeled the world’s second-largest economy and set off mass public protests that were a rare challenge to China’s leader, Xi Jinping.

media.caption: A Covid testing booth in Shanghai. The city said recently that it would no longer require residents to show a negative P.C.R. test to ride the subway or buses or to enter outdoor parks.

results.title: Peru’s President Tried to Dissolve Congress. By Day’s End, He Was Arrested.
results.abstract: Ahead of an impeachment vote by Congress, Pedro Castillo tried to dissolve the government and seize power. The attempt ended with his ouster and arrest.

media.caption: Apple updated the AirTag in February after concerns were raised about how it could be used to stalk people.

results.title: Her I.B.S. Was Misery. But What If She Actually Had Something Else?
results.abstract: For two decades, the patient was told she had irritable bowel syndrome, and now there was little she was able to eat. Then her tests showed something strange.
